ace is big enough to hide her. What else do you sugest, Rodimus?"

Rodimus smiled down at =
the female, wondering just what it was about
her that drew him to her. "You=
 will never be in danger as long as I am
around." he said. He was not sure =
where that came from, but it felt so
right when he said it.

He glanced ove=
r as Perceptor returned with some food . . .

p a little, young one"said kindly the blind predacon"You need it"
>
> Night=
light smiled again at Rodimus and nodded Perceptor. With his help, Nightlig=
ht lay down and slowly fell sleep.
>
> "Come"said Perceptor in low voice"We=
 have to let her rest"

For a moment it looked as if Rodimus was going to s=
ay no, but he
glanced over at Nightlight and nodded. She would need her res=
t. He
looked back at perceptor and followed him out of the room.

Stepping =
out of the door he allowed it to slide shut, locking
Nightlight inside. "No=
w what?" Rodimus said looking at Perceptor, his
optics thoughtful. "No doub=
t the Maximals will try to rescue her
again."
